headline: Best Breakfast Casserole (Hash Browns & Eggs)
description: This breakfast casserole with hash browns also features eggs, pork sausage, and Cheddar cheese for a classic brunch dish with all your favorites.

video.description: This hearty casserole is meaty, cheesy, and so delicious.
video.name: Hash Brown and Egg Casserole

name: Best Breakfast Casserole (Hash Browns & Eggs)
recipeIngredient: 1 (2 pound) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch square pan; add hash brown potatoes and arrange in an even layer.
Place sausage and onion in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until the sausage is browned and crumbled, about 10 minutes; drain.

Meanwhile, whisk eggs, milk, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl until well combined; pour over the potatoes and sprinkle with 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese. Add sausage mixture on top and sprinkle with remaining Cheddar. Cover with aluminum foil.

Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove foil; return casserole to the oven and bake until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, about 10 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I just tried this recipe today for dinner! With adjustments it was perfect! I doubled the eggs milk and seasonings‚Ä¶ Put it in a 9 x 13‚Ä¶ I wanted a maple flavour and didn‚Äôt have maple sausages, so while cooking the sausage and onions, I candied them with about a quarter cup of 100% maple syrup!! It was simply Divine!

This was very good. I did some things differently though. I used a 9x13 pan, 8 eggs, double milk, and double spices. I put the hash browns in the pan frozen. I made the egg mixture then mixed the sausage and cheese into it, then put the whole mixture over the hash browns and lightly pressed it down. I increased temperature to 400 degrees. I don't care for layers of cheese, so mixing it all together made it perfect. It was a nice change from the bread cube-egg casserole I usually make.
Not enough eggs, not enough milk, too many hash browns. Edible, but not really very good. I won‚Äôt make it again.
I love this recipe. However I use it with Potato tots. If I want to add a little kick I use spicy sausage. Excellent.

I made this recipe but I used 7 eggs, and added red and green peppers with the onions. I used maple sausage and the cubed frozen hash browns. I added the extra eggs since it looked like the liquid level should be a little higher, but could also depend on how deep your pan is. I used a 9 x 13 pan. I covered it and baked it as instructed I also added some shredded cheese on top at the end and it came out wonderfully. I recommend this recipe and I will definitely make it again as my family loved It.
it was great and easy to make wil be a regular now !
I used a 8 x 10‚Äù pan and 8 eggs, half cheddar and half Gouda. So good!!!!

I cant even believe you have this recipe on your site. The amount of hash browns barely fit into 8 x 8 pan with no room for the rest of the ingredients so I put it into a bigger pan. The egg mixture did not even begin to cover the hash browns so I ended up doubling it.

This is a five star recipe with the modifications, it is delicious! I used sage pork sausage, 10 eggs instead of 5, and doubled the milk. I used a glass 9x13 pan. I added a diced bell pepper which I wouldn't want to leave out and I used tater tots instead of hash browns as that's what I had on hand. For the last 4 minutes I put it under the broiler on low with the foil off. I made this for my family, but it's so good I want to invite my parents over to share some! I used tater tots, but next time will try it with hash browns.

The first time I made it, it was ok. The second time it was delicious.. I needed to season the Hash brown, had to add more ü•ö and bacon ü•ì crumbles onions bellpeppers all colors to egg mix.. Layer hash brown add pepperjack cheese top with turkey sausage add my egg mix then top with mexican style blend cheese bake hr 1.15 with foil, 15 min without foil let stand 5mins.
Excellent recipe! I prepared it on the stovetop and used the hot sausage. Turned out very well!
Delicious.. followed the recipe.. when i do this next time, i will cook it a bit longer.. the hash browns took longer to cook than what was instructed
Added fresh jalapenos and red bell pepper.
Delicious. Only change was doubled the eggs and added grated Parmesan cheese.
Delicious!!! I added spinach and used turkey sausage. Yumy
We thought this was more like a potato bake than an egg bake. We added more eggs/milk than recipe called for but the potatoes were still over powering.
Loved the recipe. Next time I will brown the potatoes first. I poured syrup on the top when done. Yum!
Turned out amazing even substituting hash browns for tater tots. Quick and easy to make. Also added bacon and ham to it. Highly recommend.

I liked how easy this recipe was, but the ratio was way off. 2 pounds of hash browns is overdoing it. Way too potatoey. Even 1 pound would still be too much. Next time I‚Äôm going to try thawing potatoes as called for, but brown and only use 16 oz. I think that would be plenty without being too little and browning first would give extra crisp and flavor.
This was NOT the recipe I was hoping it would be when I made it. My family ate it, but we all found it to be on the dry side and just ho-hum. I added an extra egg, but otherwise stuck to the recipe.
Hi my name is Daniel and I would love to attempt your family recipe. I do have a question though when it comes to the hash browns. Do you use cubed hash browns or the country hash browns
Very good, but I think a little overload on hashbrowns.
Great! I didn't have exact amounts of ingredients, so I halved it. I added salt and pepper to potatoes and a half tsp of Worcestershire sauce to the eggs.
Good breakfast casserole. Used half the potatoes and substituted the sausage with crumbled bacon (I love Costco‚Äôs bagged crumbled bacon!).
Great Recipe! I doubled the eggs, though, and would recommend that.
I just had to write my first review on this recipe. With this recipe, my two sons and myself all like it, and that is hard to do. We ate all but 1 piece.
It's amazing - but try these two changes and see what you think - (1) use 7 eggs, and (2) use Alfredo sauce versus milk. Mmmm...
Made it for Super Bowl Sunday brunch with sage flavored sausage and crispy crowns potatoes to the delight of my family. Saved it for another special occasion.

This was a solid recipe! It did not seem like it would fit in my 9x9 pan, so I put it in a 9x13 pan, which made it thinner than I would have liked. I think next time I'll increase the number of eggs to at least 8, and maybe the amount of milk too. The flavor was very mild, so I'll probably add more seasonings as well. Overall it was a good base recipe that could use some tweaks!

This was super yummy and filling... made some changes... trying to reduce calories slightly ... use 4.5 oz cooked sweet Italian pork sausage (ground). .. would like to try with turkey sausage for even lighter option ... 4 c hash browns and three oz cheese... added mushrooms and baked in the 8x8... I think next time would add one more egg...

It was a big hit for Christmas morning! Prepared the night before and cooked Christmas morning. Served with toast and jelly and fruit salad. 

( We made some changes: 1 pound of hashbrowns, not 2, mild jimmy dean sausage, sharp cheddar cheese, frozen onion, green and red pepper mix, double the garlic powder)

I used quite a few more eggs and less potato than the recipe called for. I did a similar one in the past and it just tasted like mashed potato so I am glad that I cut this back. I also added more cheese on top (How can you go wrong w that) and also rings of black olives. I will make this again
I went straight by the recipe with no substitutions or omissions. Best casserole I ever made!

Like others, I used about 1 1/2 lbs hash browns and tossed with a little melted butter, oil, s&p, garlic and onion powders making sure it was mixed thoroughly right in my 9√ó13" pan. I flattened it down and baked at 400¬∞ for about 15-20 min. Cooled it for a few minutes and then proceeded with mixing 8 eggs, 3/4 cup milk, the called for spices, and an eyeballed amount of real maple syrup. Next time I'd also add about 1 tsp dry mustard powder and maybe a few drops of hot sauce. I was short on cheese, so next time I'll load it up, likely for more than the recipe states. Served for dinner with a drizzle of real maple syrup, this was total comfort food on a snowy evening. Can't wait for the breakfast leftovers!

I thought this was really good & really easy! I cut in half for two of us & cooked an onion with the sausage, but no other changes. Husband had seconds and wants me to make it again with ham and maybe some peppers. Next time we have overnight guests this will be on the menu.
This Recipe is easy and Awesome..My boys loved it!
Perfect

I followed the recipe and it came out great. I served it for dinner and my family really liked it. Though the hashbrown was a little bland. They suggested that I should add some salt and pepper with the thawed hashbrowns and add maybe 1 or 2 more eggs. I will probably do that and maybe add some cayenne pepper to give it a little kick. But other than that, it was really good. Definitely a keeper.
Added a can of green chili‚Äôs for a little spice. It was a huge hit. Great dish for house guests.

I think it could use a little spice. Maybe some diced jalapeno or some creole seasoning. I do like the spice so this may be a personal preference. At least add a little salt and you will love this recipe.
This was pretty bland. After making, I noticed almost all the other reviewers modified the recipe.
I meal prep weekly for my Husband and I and this was an ABSOLUTE hit!

I made the recipe as is and felt like it was really bland.

We probably won‚Äôt try it again but if I was going to I‚Äôd double the milk, eggs and spices and probably only use 6oz of cheese instead of the full 12.

It seems most of the good reviews for this include a whole list of changes people made.

My family loved this! I had some potatoes to use, so I made and cooked my own shredded hash browns. I cooked them in bacon grease with seasonings. I used a 9x11 pan and it only took about 30 minutes to cook. We look forward to making it again.

I made with the ratios called for and I agree with others. WAY too much potato. I would have to do too many tweaks to get this right, so I will likely look for another casserole recipe for my next try.

This recipe is great as written and very versatile! My favorite way to make it is with cubed frozen hash browns. Fry an onion first, remove half from the pan, add in potatoes and cook a bit with the onion. I add the same spices to the potatoes (and then again to the eggs as instructed). Fry the sausage or bacon (either are good) and add the remaining onion to that mixture as the instructions state. I think adding extra spices to the potatoes and frying a bit in the pan before placing into your dish makes a big difference on flavor. I've even put the pan of potatoes in the oven for ten minutes while cooking the sausage or bacon. FYI... I use about two cups of shredded cheese (prefer my measurements other than cups ;), and layered as stated! Great recipe!
There were too many potatoes! The filling was rather bland as well. I am sorry to say that it was not very successful for me.
I sprinkled chopped green and red peppers on top to add some color.
Everyone loved it. Very simple recipe; I just added extra eggs and put it in a 13 x 9 pyrex dish.

I made this for Easter breakfast and followed the recipe exactly. I transported it to my 90 year old fathers house. My husband who doesn‚Äôt like to eat eggs loved it. My father finished a large portion. This was easy to make, remained hot for a while, and could feed a large group of people. I served it along with Pilsbury hot cinnamon rolls.
We used a13x9 pan and cut 15 minutes off the bake time. It was perfect. We will definitely make this again.

A family favorite! Easy to put together so it‚Äôs a go to for me. I add cream cheese to the sausage at the end of cooking it (before adding it to the casserole) and I put extra cheese in it and 6 eggs rather than 5 because I use 2 lbs of meat

Overall, this recipe is super easy to make and tastes good but a little bland for me. But, my kids liked it a lot. The bland part comes from the hash browns. But in combination with the salty sausage it works. I liked mine with salsa! I also did not thaw the hash browns. I shook the bag of frozen hash browns to make sure all the frozen chunks were separated. I placed them in a 9x13 pan then cooked the sausage and got everything else ready. By that time the hash browns were pretty much thawed.
I used half the hash browns and added garlic and chorizo. It was a hit in my household. Next time I will probably use the hash browns with peppers. Topped with sour cream, hot sauce, and avocado.

This turned out great, I used the frozen O‚ÄôBrien hash browns (slightly less than 2 lb bag) and omitted the onion. Also only cooked for 1 hr covered in convection oven. Next time I may add another egg or two.
Great recipe, used 3 quart dish and 1 1/2 pounds sausage and extra egg. The time and temperature was correct for my gas oven. My wife loved it!
Have made this MULTIPLE times! I sometimes use bacon instead. And I typically leave out the milk and add an extra egg or two. Seems to set better. So easy and always a hit!
Used a 9x13 pan and 6 eggs. And added a little more cheese on top for the last 10 minutes. :-)
This was easy and delicious! It went fast and my family wanted more. Thanks for posting this recipe!
Followed recipe. It had to be cooked a little longer. Family loved it and will be part of our family tradition!

The combination of foods is a winner in taste, but this was my second time in making it and I just don't like how the eggs and potatoes get all gunky together. I think I would possibly make it again without the hash browns and just make them in the skillet to serve on the side. Maybe I'll just stick with making a frittata?
I cut bacon into pieces and added to the sausage. The eight of us enjoyed! Grandkids said I need to keep this one!!

Wonderful! I used less hash browns and sausage as that was all I had, and I used 8 oz of cheddar and about 4 oz of mozzarella. Oh, and my husband controlled the onion, so there was less of that too. Still, it was very good!

I made this two years ago for Christmas using sage flavored sausage; it overpowered it. This year, I used half regular and half Italian sausage, and it was wonderful! I also par-baked the hash browns for 12 minutes to keep the texture. This is a wonderful recipe, and I hope to enjoy it for years to come!
Could use more egg, not too flavourful. Gonna try something else.

I made this for a second time today. The first time I didn‚Äôt like the the layers of ingredients so this time I mixed the potatoes, sausage and cheese together and then added the egg on top. Much better. Great recipe.

I am usually encouraged by recipes with a lot reviews and a lot of stars. First of all, this recipe needs to be made in a larger dish. I used the 2 qt dish as directed, but couldn't fit in all of the potatoes (if it's the first time I'm making a dish I always follow the recipe). Second, I will use the potatoes with peppers and onions because there was not a lot of flavor. Last, I will add some cheese to the potato layer prior to putting on the sausage and onions.

So good and very few changes made. I used a bag of shredded hash browns which I mixed with 3 TB of melted butter and some salt and pepper. Pressed into the bottom of a 13 by 9 pan and baked at 350 for about 20 minutes before adding the eggs and sausage mixture. Because I only had hot sausage I didn‚Äôt add any other spices. It was perfectly done after 50 minutes, took off the foil and baked an additional 10 minutes. A keeper!
I doubled the milk and eggs. Also, I added diced poblano peppers and green onions. This dish was delicious, my husband looooved it.

Excellent! Easy recipe and is very good with substitutions. I had no sausage or ham, but had eggs and hash browns and a pound of ground sirloin that had to be used. I did add chopped onion, garlic and green pepper to the recipe as others had recommended. I made this for dinner for my family of four and only 3 pieces remained. I will make this again!
This was great. I doubled the amount of eggs and used pre-cooked crumbled bacon from Costco. It was done in 45 minutes so I was glad I checked the oven!
It is a great breakfast casserole. The whole family was enjoying the treat.

I followed the directions exactly, as I tend to do the first time I make a new dish. It turned out very nice and even with all the reviews with alterations, this dish was great and was enjoyed by all who were here.
This can be made gluten free dairy free by using non-dairy cheese just on the top. I added mushrooms. My teens loved it.

EASY PEASY! We used venison sausage and it was delicious! I used a 9x13 pan instead of 2 qt. dish. Since i used 2 lbs of venison sausage which is very lean i added an extra egg and a little more milk. Cooked for an hour covered and then about 15 more minutes uncovered to brown the cheese.
I read the other reviews and doubled the milk and eggs, it turned out perfect.

My whole family loved this!! I swapped 1 bell pepper (chopped fine) for the yellow onion. I also added a container of Frenchs crispy fried onions to the top after I took off the foil. After the final 5-10 minutes in the oven it‚Äôs a beautiful golden brown. I served it with chunky salsa for a little kick. I hope this is helpful to everyone. Enjoy!!!
This is a fantastic recipes.

Proportionally it seemed to need some changes. Here are some changes and it was great: 2x eggs, 3x milk, 1/2 hashbrowns, added sauteed sliced mushrooms once and then sauteed chopped red bell pepper and green onion for color another time. Upped the seasonings proportionally. Sprinkled cheese on top only. Prepped night before, baked as directed.

Made it for our house guests and they loved it! Doubled the egg mixture for a 9 x 13 pan. Added chopped green chillies and turkey sausage. Definitely advise baking the shredded potatoes beforehand about 30 minutes,cooled, then topped with sausage, chillies and shredded cheese. Put that in the fridge overnight. Added the egg mixture in the morning and baked it at 350 for 1 hour. Delicious!
Everyone loves this casserole! It is always a big hit and so easy to make!
Love this easy delicious recipe! It started as a Christmas morning dish but my kids will come over any time I make it, so I make it at least once a month!

Awesome! Will definitely make this again! When I go out to eat, my favorite thing to get is eggs, hashbrowns and bacon... and then mix it all together on my plate. This casserole does that delicious combination for me (I did bacon instead of sausage because our other dish already had sausage). Thank you for posting this recipe... definitely a keeper!
Used half the amount of hashbrowns.
Was super easy. However, i doubled the sausage, egg, and seasonings (not the milk). I also used a pound of shredded colby jack. Really kicked the flavor up a notch.
I used turkey sausage. Everyone at the brunch liked it. Next time I think I will add some cream of mushroom soup to the potatoes (as one reviewer suggested), as I found the potatoes a little dry.

I added more sauteed veggies, including portabella mushrooms and spinach, used Johnsonville maple flavored breakfast sausage, doubled the eggs and used half and half for milk. I used salt, pepper, and Penzey's Greek seasoning in the egg mix, and baked the casserole uncovered for an hour total. Big hit with the family. Great for feeding a night crowd!
I added some fennel seeds to the sausage...that part was good, but it was too dry, needs more moisture...maybe more egg and milk or a sauce of some kind. I used ketchup.

Very good - I used 1 1/2 cups home fries saut√©ed in onion and seasoning salt, a 9x13 dish and 11 eggs but otherwise followed the recipe. Next time I'll use less potatoes and even more eggs.

**updated review**

First time I made this recipe I gave it a 4 and really it was a 3.5 because the potatoes were too bland and the texture didn‚Äôt help the dish. 
Just made it again with the following changes and it is now a 5! Exactly what I had been hoping for!
9by 13 dish
13 eggs with milk and seasonings doubled
1 approx 1lb bag of breakfast potatoes
Maple flavoured sausage 
Used mix of white and orange cheddar plus some mozzarella 
Baked the potatoes in 3 tbsps melted butter and some seasoning salt for 30 minutes
Added garlic and onion to the sausage 
Cooked some yellow pepper and more onion and the added it to the potatoes once they were done

The additional seasonings, cooking the potatoes ahead of time and the different cheeses made this dish so flavourful and tasty!

The flavor was bland for my taste, and a little dry. If I choose to make it again-I'd probably add a little more milk to it. But on the otherhand, I did use refridgerated hash browns, rather than frozen so that might be why. But all in all - good and easy. I'll probably try it again w/some modifications.

It gets 4 because my family liked it. I added some diced red pepper for color. It think it was a bit dry so next time I‚Äôll bake it fewer minutes. And I don‚Äôt think the hash browns need to be thawed first.

This was a crowd pleaser. I did pre-cook the potatoes while browning the sausage. I added a bit of leftover bacon I had on hand. Used 10 eggs instead of only 5‚Äìseemed kind of skimpy in the pan. Served this Easter brunch and ended up with an empty pan!
I use more eggs than called for.
This was easy and delicious!
Very good with some tweaks. Baked in 9 x 13 pan. Used 12 eggs, more cheese and more milk (maybe double? Can't remember!)
This recipe doesn't work. As everyone said, the dish is too small, you really need more like 10 eggs. So read all the reviews to be able to make it edible or find another recipe.
Made it for my daughter after her surgery

It‚Äôs unanimous, my wife, daughter and I all give this 5 stars! I used a chug of Owens Natural Sausage and made it in 2 square pans. Just the perfect proportion of hash browns, egg, & seasonings. This is a keeper!
Made it foe the family it turned out great
